summary: Women's participation is a key driver of economic growth. But women may face barriers to participation—violence, restricted rights, and more. Trade agreements can help empower women to participate in economies. A small but growing number of U.S. and other countries' trade agreements contain gender-specific provisions. Less than half of U.S. Free Trade Agreements, and 7 of 62 U.S. Trade and Investment Framework Agreements, include provisions...
title: International Trade: Trade Agreements Increasingly Promote Women's Rights and Economic Interests, but Barriers Remain
